title: Survey of New Jersey Open Records Act Resources (City of Piscataway FOIA)

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Survey of New Jersey Open Records Act Resources (City of Piscataway FOIA)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of any budget, accounting, or other records sufficient to show the expenses or resources necessary for the city (including any departments thereof) to respond to public records requests.

2. A copy of the job description for any person (whether employed by the city or any departments thereof) whose primary responsibilities include responding to or managing public records requests. If a separate record identifies the anticipated or actual amount of time the person spends on their duties (i.e., identifying how much of their time is spent on a given subject), please provide that record, as well.

3. Any record sufficient to show the salary of any person (whether employed by the city or any departments thereof) whose primary responsibilities include responding to or managing public records requests.

4. If the city maintains a log of public records requests, please provide a copy of the log dating back to January 1, 2022.

Requests 1-3 are limited to documents generated during or concerning the last fiscal year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Survey of New Jersey Open Records Act Resources (City of Piscataway FOIA)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following New Jersey Open Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on April 16, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: OPRA Extension - A. Steinbaugh - OPRA Salary / Description / Costs
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Your OPRA request requires additional time beyond the seven (7) business days for legal review. OPRA allows custodians to seek extensions of time pursuant to N.J.S.A. 47:1A-5.i. Specifically, OPRA states that, "the requestor shall be advised by the custodian when the record can be made available. If the record is not made available by that time, access shall be deemed denied."

Your request requires an extension of time until Monday, April 29th

Thank you,

title: Documents on Illegal Chinese Migration (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Documents on Illegal Chinese Migration (Department of Homeland Security)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records, cited in the footnotes of the attached Homeland Intelligence Today article:

CBP Border Patrol Apprehension Data, FY 2011-2016 (footnote 1)
Chinese Influx FY2016 (footnote 7)
Peluche HSO Transporting UDAS from Central America, Turkey, and China into the United States (footnote 8)
Smuggling Routes and Methods from China to the United States (footnote 17)
Members of an Unidentified Church in China Facilitating Travel for Chinese Nationals Attempting to Illegally enter the United States Though Mexico (footnote 18)
CBP - Chinese Nationals Apprehended Near McAllen, Texas Provide Details of Their Travel Route to the United States (footnote 19)
Suspected Chinese Nationals' Smugglers Identified at TJ Airport (footnote 22)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am a reporter for the National Interest, and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

The National Interest is widely recognized for its reporting, publishing regular features on issues of public interest and importance. In addition, I have covered areas related to this request, and plan to use my editorial skills to analyze and produce original reporting work for millions of monthly readers at NationalInterest.org.

If you have any questions about my media status, please contact me.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Documents on Illegal Chinese Migration (Department of Homeland Security)
communications.communication:
Hello,

This is Matthew Petti from the National Interest. I am writing in regards to your final response to my request,  2020-FQFO-01437. As you noted, you have transferred the request to Customs and Border Protection, presumably because some of the documents I requested originated in CBP. However, the following citatione appear to refer to DHS (and not CBP) documents:
- DHS; IIR 4 006 0620 16; 27 FEB 2016; DOI 30 DEC 2015; Peluche HSO Transporting UDAS from Central America, Turkey, and China into the United States (footnote 8)
- DHS; IIR 4 012 0079; 08 SEP 2016; DOI 14-24 APR 2016; Smuggling Routes and Methods from China to the United States (footnote 17)
- DHS; IIR 4 042 0179 15; 29 MAY 2015; DOI 01 Mar 2015; CBP - Chinese Nationals Apprehended Near McAllen, Texas Provide Details of Their Travel Route to the United States (footnote 19)

Therefore, I believe your final response may have been made in error. Would you be able to reopen the request for just those three documents, or should I file a new one? I look forwards to hearing back from you soon.

Best,
Matthew

communications.subject: Acknowledgement Letter
communications.communication:
Matthew Petti 
DEPT MR 98031 
411A Highland Ave 
Sommerville, MA, 02144 
07/23/2020 
CBP-2020-067978 
Dear Matthew Petti: 
This notice acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) received on 07/23/2020.     Please use the following unique FOIA tracking number CBP-2020-067978 to track the status of your request.  If you have not already done so, you must create a FOIAonline account at https://foiaonline.gov.  This is the only method available to check the status of your pending FOIA request. (https://foiaonline.regulations.gov/) 
Provisions of the Act allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations outlined on the DHS website, https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations. By submitting your request, you have agreed to pay up to $25.00 in applicable processing fees, if any fees associated with your request exceed this amount, CBP shall contact you; however, the first 100 pages are free. (https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations) 
Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request.  Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, CBP processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.  Although CBP’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  [As your request seeks documents that will require a thorough and wide-ranging search, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As your request seeks a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to  6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As the subject matter of your request is of substantial interest to two or more components of CBP or of substantial interest to another agency, we will need to consult with those entities before we issue a final response.  Due to these unusual circumstances, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] 
CBP’s FOIA Division is working hard to reduce the amount of time necessary to respond to FOIA requests.  We truly appreciate your continued patience. 
For additional information please consult CBP FOIA website please click on FOIA Act Resources or visit (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia. (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) 
Sincerely, 
U.S. Customs and Border Protection

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56:

I request any/all public records of the following:

1.	COCAINE – Use of cocaine by Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers on or off elementary school grounds.
2.	FIREARMS/HANDGUNS – Names of all Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers in possession of HANDGUNS or FIREARMS on elementary school grounds.
3.	KIDNAPPING – any records or police reports referencing KIDNAPPING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
4.	RESISTING ARREST - any records or police reports referencing RESISTING ARREST by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
5.	CARJACKING - any records or police reports referencing CARJACKING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
6.	DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL - any records or police reports referencing DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
7.	HIT AND RUN - any records or police reports referencing HIT AND RUN by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
8.	OBSTRUCTION - any records or police reports referencing OBSTRUCTION by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
9.	CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES - copies of all CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES of any current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
10.	GUILTY PLEAS – copies of all STATEMENT OF DEFENDANT ON PLEA OF GUILTY entered into by any former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
11.	COMPLAINTS - any records referencing COMPLAINTS by the POLICE or the GENERAL PUBLIC about current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.

In accordance with RCW 42.56.520, we are notifying you that additional time is required to process your request due to our current volume of public record requests and our need to prioritize other essential government functions, the size and scope of the responsive records, and/or legal review.

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Pinal County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide an electronic copy of your agency's Policy & Procedures and Complaint Form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Byron Daniel Bernstein (Reckful)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records related to Byron Daniel Bernstein (Date of Birth: May 8, 1989) from June 30th, 2020 to July 15, 2020 to include records related to his precise date of death on July 2nd, 2020 in Austin, Texas. He is better known online as Reckful for being a Twitch streamer and professional esports player.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: R121481-122823
communications.communication:
Dear Bailey Pillon: 
 
Thank you for your interest in the public records of the Austin Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 12/28/2023 and given the reference number R121481-122823 for tracking purposes. 
Please be advised that the Austin Police Department’s Central Records Division receives over 2500 requests for information a month. These requests are processed in the order received, and we strive to respond to each request promptly, as required by law. 
Please know that, as a result of the large volume of requests received, the anticipated timeframe for responding to your request may take 10 business days if it is simply an offense report you're requesting.  If you are requesting body cam, dash cam, or other related records your request could take up to 30 days. 
You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Austin Public Records Center. 
Austin Police Department

communications.subject: [Austin Public Records Center] :: R121481-122823
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

APD PIO has received your request and will work to process the information requested.  As the process starts, please confirm if you are willing to exclude all records and information that are or that maybe considered confidential by law, such as an open investigation, pending prosecution or common-law privacy. 

Please know that, as a result of the large volume of requests received, the anticipated timeframe for responding to your request is approximately 45-60 business days. 

For more information on the Public Information Act, please visit the Texas Attorney General website. 
If you have any questions, please contact PIO at (512) 974-5017. 
Thank you for contacting Austin Police Department. 

Public Information Office

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request #R121481-122823
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Thank you for the reply! Regarding the above, I am requesting all records with the criteria and time line specified in the first correspondence.

Regarding your statement to confirm:

If an open investigation exists or prosecution, I request such records unless it is reasonably foreseeable to adversely impact such an investigation or prosecution. If that is the case, I ask that redactions be carefully considered if feasible or such records excluded if not. 

Regarding common law privacy, Byron Daniel Bernstein (better known as Reckful), is and was a well-known public figure. That said, any individual within the responsive records who is not a public figure you may and I ask that that be redacted in a manner you deem appropriate. 

Thank you,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Information Request: Córdova
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata for email communications which include both Paul Córdova and anyone with a ShotSpotter email address (*@shotspotter.com) or SoundThinking email address (*@soundthinking.com) as either the sender, recipient, CC'ed, or BCC'ed, sent between the dates of 1/1/2021 and 4/18/2024. 

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please do not include duplicate emails. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: 23-24-12589 Acknowledgment of Receipt Re: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Information Request: Córdova
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,



Aldine ISD is in receipt of your request for public information. The
District will begin to compile the information requested and determine
whether or not any of the information is believed to be confidential by law
or excepted from public disclosure.



This process may take up to ten (10) business days. Should the District
need additional time to comply with your request, you will receive notice
of the reason for the delay and an approximate date the information will be
available.



To avoid diverting funds from the educational process, it may be necessary
for the District to recover the cost of providing the information. For
example, pursuant to Section 552.261 of the Texas Government Code, the
District will charge ten ($.10) cents per page for paper copies, if
applicable. The District will pass along other costs incurred. In the event
that the charges for the information exceed $100.00 you may be required to
post a cash bond before soft or hard copies are made. The district will
provide a cost estimate before processing requests anticipated to be
greater than $40.  Typically, there is no charge for information that is
readily available.



If you have any questions, or desire additional information, please feel
free to contact our office.

Thank you,

Wendi Faughn


<https://aldineisd.org/>

Wendi Faughn

Paralegal for Public Information Officer


*Ashney Shelly*

Public Information Officer


Legal Department

communications.subject: 23-25-12589 Responsive Information
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,



The records responsive to your request are attached.



Please feel free to contact our office if you have any questions or
problems with opening the attachment.



Your request with the district is now closed.



Sincerely,



Wendi Faughn


<https://aldineisd.org/>

Wendi Faughn

Paralegal for Public Information Officer


*Ashney Shelly*

Public Information Officer


Legal Department

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Ellsberg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former U.S. military analyst Daniel Ellsberg (April 7, 1931 – June 16, 2023). His death is widely-known and has been widely reported, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. You may find an obituary from NBC News attached below, and a statement by Mr. Ellsberg's son at the following link: https://twitter.com/RobertEllsberg/status/1669776046751899648

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596242-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for this partial response. In your letter, you write:

"Please be advised that additional records responsive to your subject exist. If this release of previously processed material does not satisfy your request, you must advise us that you want the additional records processed."

I would like to formally advise that I would like the additional records processed. Please confirm receipt of my request. Thank you again for your prompt attention to this matter.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596242-000
communications.communication:
The FBI has received your additional correspondence regarding your Freedom of Information/Privacy Act (FOIPA) request and it has been forwarded to the assigned analyst for review and determination.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Voluntary Recognitions for Quarter 1, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to determine the number of voluntary employee union recognitions from January 01, 2024 through March 31, 2024. If available, please provide records about individual recognition with such fields as employer, location, description of bargaining unit, union, and size of unit, and any other non-exempt fields on Form NLRB-5581.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

communications.subject: Thank you for submitting your foia.gov request
communications.communication:
Thank you for submitting your FOIA request through FOIA.GOV to National Labor Relations Board! 
You can track the status of your request, communicate with the agency regarding this request, or search previously released documents in our reading room using the SecureRelease portal. If you do not already have a SecureRelease portal account you can sign-up (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) here, just make sure to use 161539-06831835@requests.muckrock.com when you sign up to gain access to your request details. (https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/) 

Should you have an inquiry related to your SecureRelease user account or concerning www.securerelease.us, please email SecureRelease Support and a member of our team will be happy to assist. (https://www.securerelease.us/) 
 

Take care, 

 
SecureRelease™ Support (Contractor) 
securereleasepublicsupport@deloitte.com  Do NOT respond to this email. The SecureRelease™ Support desk is not operated by a FOIA Office or Agency personnel, and does not process requests--please do not send request details, supporting documentation, or other sensitive information to this inbox. Additionally, please note that SecureRelease™ Support is unable to provide updates concerning the processing, status, or timeline of requests, nor can we offer guidance with regard to agency procedures. For these inquiries, please contact the Agency or refer to their website.

communications.subject: Acknowledgment of FOIA Request (2024-NLFO-01446)
communications.communication:
04/01/2024 
Forest Gregg 
Muckrock 

re: FOIA Request number 2024-NLFO-01446 

Dear Forest Gregg: 

This is an acknowledgment of receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated 4/1/2024 submitted to the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) FOIA Branch and received on 4/1/2024, seeking "records sufficient to determine the number of voluntary employee union recognitions from January 01, 2024 through March 31, 2024. If available, please provide records about individual recognition with such fields as employer, location, description of bargaining unit, union, and size of unit, and any other non-exempt fields on Form NLRB-5581." We have docketed your request as 2024-NLFO-01446.  Please use this request number in all future correspondence concerning this request. 

The NLRB FOIA Branch processes FOIA requests on "first-in, first-out" basis. The actual processing time will depend on the complexity of the request and whether or not it involves sensitive or voluminous records, or extensive searches and/or consultations. 

Please visit our website at https://www.nlrb.gov/guidance/freedom-of-information-act-foia/foia-reference-guide for more information about the FOIA and the NLRB FOIA regulations. If you have any questions about the status of your request, please feel free to contact me, Jodilyn Breirather at (414) 930-7208 or by e-mail at jodilyn.breirather@nlrb.gov. 

Sincerely, 
Jodilyn Breirather 
FOIA Specialist 

FOIA Branch 
National Labor Relations Board

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: FOIA Final Response: Release in Full (2024-NLFO-01446)
communications.communication:
05/01/2024 
Forest Gregg 
Muckrock 

re: FOIA Request number 2024-NLFO-01446 

Dear Forest Gregg: 

This is in response to your FOIA Request dated 4/1/2024, received on 4/1/2024, and docketed as 2024-NLFO-01446. 

Your request has been received and processed with the following disposition: release in full. Please see the attached determination letter for more information about this disposition, our analysis of your request, and your appeal rights. 

Please use the following link to navigate to these records. This link will be active for one year. 

To retrieve the records associated with this request use this link Released Documents for Request 2024-NLFO-01446 or enter https://www.securerelease.us/request-details/285BE56B-E314-4ADD-B5C1-F7D5AB06131B/2 in your browser’s address bar. Please login or create a new user account using the email address associated with your records request: 161539-06831835@requests.muckrock.com (https://www.securerelease.us/request-details/285BE56B-E314-4ADD-B5C1-F7D5AB06131B/2) 

If you have any questions about your request, you may contact me, Jodilyn Breirather at (414) 930-7208 or by e-mail at jodilyn.breirather@nlrb.gov. 

Sincerely, 
Jodilyn Breirather 
FOIA Specialist 

FOIA Branch 
National Labor Relations Board

title: Federal Marshal Operation on Jan 5, 2022 at Playa Palms Apartments (Department of Justice, United States Marshals Service, Office of the Federal Detention Trustee)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Federal Marshal Operation on Jan 5, 2022 at Playa Palms Apartments (Department of Justice, United States Marshals Service, Office of the Federal Detention Trustee)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On January 5th, 2022 twenty or more armed US Marshals were present at the Playa Palms Apartments from approximately 9:00 am to 9:00 pm.  Along with 3 mobile command centers and numerous state, local, and county law enforcement officers.  Please disclose all documents pertaining to this operation.  Playa Palms Apartments is located at 2200 W San Angelo St, Gilbert AZ, 85233.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Victor Montoya

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Federal Marshal Operation on Jan 5, 2022 at Playa Palms Apartments (Department of Justice, United States Marshals Service, Office of the Federal Detention Trustee)
communications.communication:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 15, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Federal Marshal Operation on Jan 5, 2022 at Playa Palms Apartments (Department of Justice, United States Marshals Service, Office of the Federal Detention Trustee)

communications.subject: Re:  Freedom of Information Act Request 2022-USMS-000594
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor; 
The United States Marshals Service (USMS) is responding to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request 2022-USMS-000594, which was originally sent to you on 7/11/2023.  Please find attached the final disclosure. 
Sincerely, 
USMS FOIA Admin NOTICE:  This email (including any attachments) is intended for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed.  It may contain information that is privileged, confidential, or otherwise protected by applicable law.  If you are not the intended recipient (or the recipient's agent), you are hereby notified that unauthorized dissemination, distribution, copying, or use of this email or its contents is prohibited and may violate applicable law. If you received this email in error, please notify the sender immediately and destroy all copies. The United States Marshals Service would likeyour opinion on the processing of this request. The survey is optional and willbe used in furtherance of improving upon the FOIA requesting process. Allresponses will be reviewed by an independent component of the USMS and not bythe FOIA Office itself; accordingly, any responses received will not affect theprocessing of your request: https://usms.gov1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1ADObMYFw7DI3Y2 (https://usms.gov1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1ADObMYFw7DI3Y2)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Phoenix Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide an electronic copy of your agency's Policy & Procedures and Complaint Form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Albany, Schenectady, and Troy Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) for the period from January 1, 2018, to the present.

Specifically, I am seeking the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.

2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including:
2a. The date of the complaint
2b. The location (address or nearest cross streets) of the complaint
2c. The nature of the complaint (e.g., odor, taste, discoloration, contamination concerns)
2d. Any actions taken by your agency/authority/utility to address the complaint
2e. The resolution or current status of the complaint

3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

If any of this information is available in electronic format, I kindly request that you provide it via email. If physical copies are necessary, please inform me of any copying or postage fees in advance, and I will make arrangements for payment.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a detailed explanation for the denial and inform me of any appeal procedures available under New York State law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)
communications.communication:
Subject: FOIL Appeal for Denial of Access - Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)

Dear Records Access Officer,

I am writing to appeal the summary denial of access to records that I requested under the New York Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) on March 15, 2023. The request sought records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Albany, Schenectady, and Troy Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) from January 1, 2018, to the present. I have not received a response, acknowledgment, or any communication from the Troy Water Department regarding my request. Pursuant to FOIL, the agency is required to respond within five business days.

As a reminder, my original request sought the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.
2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including the date, location, nature of the complaint, any actions taken, and the resolution or current status.
3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

I followed up on my original request with two subsequent emails on April 11, 2023, and April 26, 2023, requesting a response or an update on the status of my request. However, I have not received any acknowledgment or response from the Troy Water Department.

The summary denial of access to the requested records is in violation of FOIL. I respectfully request that you reconsider my request and provide the requested records or a valid explanation for withholding them within ten business days, as required by FOIL.

If my appeal is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial and inform me of any further appeal procedures available under New York State law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to receiving your response.
A letter stating that the request appeal has been rejected.

files.title: Appeal Rejected
files.source: Troy Water Department, Troy, NY

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Troy Water Department)
communications.communication:
I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding my Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request. I appreciate your attention to this matter, and I would like to address some of the points you raised in your letter.

Firstly, I understand your concern about the method of submission and tracking of FOIL requests. However, I would like to clarify that my request was submitted through MuckRock, a widely recognized platform used for submitting and tracking FOIL requests. This platform is designed to ensure transparency, accountability, and ease of use for both the requestor and the agency. It is not intended to circumvent any established procedures but to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the FOIL process.

Secondly, regarding the issue of timeliness, I would like to remind you that according to Article 6 (Section 84-90) of the New York State's Freedom of Information Law, an agency is required to respond to a FOIL request within five business days of receipt. If the agency cannot provide the requested records within that timeframe, it must provide a written acknowledgment of receipt and a reasonable date by which the request will be granted or denied. In this case, I have not received such acknowledgment or estimated date.

Lastly, I would like to reiterate my commitment to working collaboratively with your agency to fulfill this FOIL request. I understand the importance of following proper procedures and am willing to cooperate fully to ensure that this process is carried out in accordance with the law.

I kindly request that you reconsider your position and provide the requested records or a reasonable timeline for their provision. I look forward to your prompt response.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: SBF - Tiffany Fong Interview (Securities and Exchange Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any emails containing "Tiffany Fong" "@TiffanyFong_" or "@tiffanyfong" and/or references to "SBF’s First Interview After FTX’s Collapse" and "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DezodR9hNI".

Likely custodian would be the Division of Enforcement.

Date: November 2022 - January 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Reynolds

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Ellsberg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any FBI files on Daniel Ellsberg. Born April 7, 1931 in Chicago, Illinois, Daniel Ellsberg died June 16, 2023 in Kensington, California. He was America's most famous whistleblower. His death at age 92 was widely reported in the media in June, 2023. He was the husband of the American journalist Patricia Marx Ellsberg. He is also known by the name Dan Ellsberg.

Records relating to or mentioning Daniel Ellsberg. Major media outlets across America as of June 16th, 2023 have reported his death including: https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2023/06/16/daniel-ellsberg-pentagon-papers-dead/ https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/16/us/daniel-ellsberg-dead.html

Please conduct searches of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the SENTINEL system, FBI email system, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Records System, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, Counter-drug Information Indices System (CIIS), Investigative Data Warehouse (IDW) including but not limited to Investigative Data Warehouse - Secret, IDW-S Core, SPT, and DOCLAB-S, FBI Automated Case Support system (ACS), subset of the Electronic Case File (ECF) system, National Crime Information Center (NCIC), Combined DNA Index System (CODIS), Integrated Automated Fingerprint Identification System (IAFIS), Interstate Photo System (IPS) and/or Facial Recognition Databases such as those used by FACE (Facial Analysis, Comparison, and Evaluation) specialists, and the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA) warrant applications and/or Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court (FISC) record filings, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please further consult all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other data sources containing potentially-responsive materials related to Daniel Ellsberg.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, investigations, inquiries, audio files, photographs or image files, video files, memos, email systems, directives, network packet captures, meeting minute notes, calendar entries, and any other data or data format that is used by the FBI. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, code names, nicknames, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency or any other agency that is known to the FBI. Please additionally include searches for inter-agency or non-agency communications accessible by the FBI about Daniel Ellsberg.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

It is my understanding that your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, which remain technically under your agency’s control (see 36 CFR 1250.8). Please also conduct a search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for records related to Daniel Ellsberg.

Furthermore, I request the FOIA log and copies of all other requests for information on Daniel Ellsberg including the responsive documents.

Daniel Ellsberg was a public figure. This request is a critical part of a journalistic research project which requires the responsive documents for informing the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Appelbaum

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596215-000
communications.communication:
Hello,

I am writing to follow up on recent communication regarding my FOIA request regarding Dr. Daniel Ellsberg.

Thank you for sending copies of previously released information about Dr. Daniel Ellsberg in partial fulfillment of FOIPA Request No.: 1596215-000. I see that in the reply that contains these previously released documents, additional records that are responsive to my request exist. I am writing to confirm within the allotted thirty day window that this material does not satisfy my request as most of the documents are more than forty years old, and many are much older. I understand that Dr. Daniel Ellsberg continued to be of interest to the FBI long after the early 1980s. I request that the additional records about my requested subject be processed.

Thank you for your time and assistance in this matter.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596215-000
communications.communication:
The FBI has received your additional correspondence regarding your Freedom of Information/Privacy Act (FOIPA) request and it has been forwarded to the assigned analyst for review and determination.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Lester Bernstein, FBI file
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents and files on, about, or mentioning Lester Bernstein, a former top editor of Newsweek magazine whose journalistic career also included stints with the New York Times, Time magazine and NBC. Mr. Bernstein died on November 27, 2014. 

https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/lester-bernstein-wide-ranging-journalist-who-led-newsweek-dies-at-94/2014/12/02/533361ac-7984-11e4-84d4-7c896b90abdc_story.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Runa Sandvik

    a former top editor of Newsweek magazine whose journalistic career also
    included stints with the New York Times, Time magazine and NBC. Mr.
    Bernstein died on November 27, 2014.
    
    
    https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/lester-bernstein-wide-ranging-journalist-who-led-newsweek-dies-at-94/2014/12/02/533361ac-7984-11e4-84d4-7c896b90abdc_story.html
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me

    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM

title: Request to Department of Defense for list of 2023 film collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Department of Defense for list of 2023 film collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the Department of Defense (DoD)Re has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2023. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, Entertainment Media Liaison Office (EMLO) reports. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Student visas
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A digital table (.xls, .xlsx, .csv, or similar format) containing information about all F-1 student visa holders who used the Optional Practical Training (OPT) portion of the F-1 visa from 2017-2022, with the following fields of data:
- City of student's address in the U.S. 
- State of student's address in the U.S. 
- Employer name
- City of employer's address
- State of employer's address
- Student's country of birth
- Student's country of citizenship
- Student's level of education
- Title of first major
- Title of second major
- Degree level (bachelors, masters, doctorate)
- STEM or non-STEM degree
- Name of school
- City of school
- State of school
- City of student's foreign address
- State or province of student's foreign address
- Country of student's foreign address
- Employment start year
- Employment end year
- Actual employment start year
- Actual employment end year

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Erica Raleigh

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #COW2022005696
communications.communication:
Good evening,

Thank you for your inquiry.  Please note the estimated completion date of August 15, 2024 is an estimated date based on average processing times.  Individual requests may take more or less time.  For this reason, USCIS also provides your "Place in Queue".  We reviewed your request and determined it is currently 149 in a queue of approximately 308 requests.  In the interest of fairness to all requestors, USCIS processes requests in the order received and will process your request as soon as possible.  Please feel free to monitor your place in queue by utilizing the following link https://first.uscis.gov/#/check-status.

At your service,

Linda Davis
Public Liaison
Customer and Support Team, FOIA
National Records Center
Lee's Summit, MO 64064

The documents related to this request have been digitally released. title: Fresno PD misconduct records re: Christopher Martinez

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Fresno PD misconduct records re: Christopher Martinez
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All available misconduct records or serious use-of-force investigations regarding Fresno Police Department officer Christopher Martinez .

Please note that under Senate Bill 1421’s amendments to California Penal Code sections 832.7 and 832.8, certain types police misconduct records are now public records under California law. These records include:
- Records related to any incident where a law enforcement officer fired a gun at a person (regardless of whether someone was hit), or used force that resulted in serious injury or death.
- Records related to incidents where the agency found that an officer committed sexual assault against a member of the public—which includes attempts to coerce sex or proposition sex while on duty.
- Records related to incidents where the agency found that an officer engaged in dishonesty in the investigation, reporting, or prosecution of crime or police misconduct. This kind of dishonesty could include filing a false report, testifying untruthfully, or planting evidence.

I therefore request any such records concerning officer Martinez during his employment at the Fresno Police Department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.subject: FRESNO CA City Public Records Request::R042681-100523:: R042681-100523
communications.communication:
Dear CJ Ciaramella: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of City of Fresno. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the California Public Records Act (CPRA). Your request was received on 8/22/2019 and given the reference number R042681-100523 for tracking purposes. Your request mentioned: 
 Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
- All available misconduct records or serious use-of-force investigations regarding Fresno Police Department officer Christopher Martinez .
Please note that under Senate Bill 1421’s amendments to California Penal Code sections 832.7 and 832.8, certain types police misconduct records are now public records under California law. These records include:
- Records related to any incident where a law enforcement officer fired a gun at a person (regardless of whether someone was hit), or used force that resulted in serious injury or death.
- Records related to incidents where the agency found that an officer committed sexual assault against a member of the public—which includes attempts to coerce sex or proposition sex while on duty.
- Records related to incidents where the agency found that an officer engaged in dishonesty in the investigation, reporting, or prosecution of crime or police misconduct. This kind of dishonesty could include filing a false report, testifying untruthfully, or planting evidence.
I therefore request any such records concerning officer Martinez during his employment at the Fresno Police Department. 
If reassigned to the City Attorney's Office for processing, the City Attorney’s Office will coordinate with other City Departments regarding the collection and review process of responsive records. Within 10 days of receipt of your request, you will be contacted about the availability of the records in question, unless the response time is extended by written notification to you. PLEASE NOTE: The CPRA does not require a governmental body to create new records to respond to a request, do legal research, or answer questions that seek information only and do not seek production of an existing public record. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below. You will receive an email if an extension of time is required and once your request has been completed. 
If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact the City Attorney’s Office at 559-621-7500. For Police Department requests, you may contact the Police Department's Record's Division at 559-621-2534. 
Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Fresno 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HfI5405t2bA54aoypXnj-2FSO07RI3WToebYy1O5awiQ2k08sKgL16ge67DeHxSRcKX7C5BlSwfeiMJFXKUFBNWCg-3DB2LI_5gb6S8lW0f0M2KkrlI-2BS-2BcHQXA6bPFQbN7JsJHi1CsMFw4q-2FO8qzxDCbLVPG4zewyIIkxXn10-2BDuVLqh8TqiXaD7IDFLm-2B29fAm33O0a631I0OzDAiCt-2FRvNNvABZn7JHsA1EhLNiHkJTBgZvHGF8dIC7BXeAQGJQK4FhypHRpWTDY-2FSFgJFxzNV63nRvZXGuljWbAd8lFe4e0OliDq8gyEBBZ5NgmA5asX7rcln5CvVxzPYY43pXwlqQg8v7dOvP8fu3iz-2FMMiZEEdxRvBgEz7ra2-2FdaqBP7pO6tZY3SVc9uTf3cbScIpOqbvj99Rmfeipke0ZrDwbH8v5b-2FpSum2bYMjCHfsYngHw7EVWA9qig8J5o4uvT25TdjSeFQyUUPNclNJdvtxZwyqP-2BwCeAKg-3D-3D)

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Michael Sean Pollock Autopsy Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Michael Sean Pollock autopsy report

Birth: 8/25/1989, death: est. 9/29/2013

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Florence Earl

title: Employee concerns/complaints over working for Ryan Kelly

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Employee concerns/complaints over working for Ryan Kelly
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All complaints filed to by employees to human resources, their supervisors, the mayor,  the administrator, legal or any other individual or entity regarding being scared to work with Ryan Kelly or their concerns with working for Ryan Kelly after his felony arrest for eavesdropping on them and his felony arrest for burglary and the inventory of his weapons found in his house without a FOID.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carolyn

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Personnel Files, Principals
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

*Leonard Harris, current principal at Nancy B Jefferson High School
*Sharnette Sims, current principal at York High School
*Joenile Albert-Reese, current principal at Pritzker Elementary
*Heidy Moran, current principal at Schurz High School

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15035

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
04/30/2024 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N015035-031824 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals: 

*Leonard Harris, current principal at Nancy B Jefferson High School 
*Sharnette Sims, current principal at York High School 
*Joenile Albert-Reese, current principal at Pritzker Elementary 
*Heidy Moran, current principal at Schurz High School 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-personnel-files-principals-160716%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ9RYhgoBNi1Pb8mf_KKixYw%3A1rmPYI%3AaOzCI_BtKIDQSOdqPVxu4DGTfL27ateIW9Mwgit9Yok 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please be advised that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, signatures, personal addresses, health information, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Section 7.5(h) exempts from disclosure “information the disclosure of which is exempted under the State Officials and Employees Ethics Act, and records of any lawfully created State or local inspector general’s office that would be exempt if created or obtained by an Executive Inspector General’s office.” 5 ILCS 140/7.5(h). 
Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r), which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of students and any student records in which a student may be individually identified by a school regardless of how or where the information pursuant to (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Redactions have also been made in accordance with 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(j)(iii) which exempts from release information concerning a school or university’s adjudication of student disciplinary cases, but only to the extent that disclosure would unavoidably reveal the identity of the student. 
Certain incident report entries related to this request are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). This section exempts from disclosure information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law. Specifically, the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act, section 325 ILCS 5/1, states that all records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law; and 820 ILCS 40/13 of the Illinois Personel Records Review Act, which prohibits the identification of individuals who are the subject of an unfounded DCFS report. Names and personal information of complainants and victims have been redacted pursuant to section 7(d)(iv) of the FOIA which exempts confidential information furnished only by the confidential source, or persons who file complaints with or provide information to administrative, investigative, law enforcement, or penal agencies. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USPS Kiosk Digital Photographs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Data management policies regarding USPS Self Service Kiosks (SSKs)
- Records related to USPS SSKs taking digital photographs of customers, excluding photographs of customers
- Privacy Impact Assessments for USPS SSKs
- Business Impact Assessments for USPS SSKs

For reference, a FOIA request from the Electronic Privacy Information Center found the kiosks captured and stored photographs of customers for a period of 30 days, this request seeks similar records. (See https://epic.org/wp-content/uploads/privacy/postal/postalapc.pdf)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

title: NYS Climate Affordability Study Contract (New York State Energy Research and Development Authority)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYS Climate Affordability Study Contract (New York State Energy Research and Development Authority)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

> A copy of the contract with strategic consulting firm ICF that resulted in the publication of the "Climate Affordability Study" published in December 2023 to inform New York State’s forthcoming Cap-and-Invest Program.
> A list of names of ICF contractors involved in the preparation of the Climate Affordability Study.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYS Climate Affordability Study Contract (New York State Energy Research and Development Authority)
communications.communication:
Dear Madeleine Stone-

I write to acknowledge receipt of the request that you submitted to the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority ("NYSERDA").  Your request seeks the information outlined below.

Your request has been referred to the appropriate NYSERDA program areas to search for the records that are responsive to your request.  NYSERDA will contact you in twenty (20) business days to (i) advise whether it has any records that are responsive to your request; (ii) grant or deny your request, if it has responsive records; or (iii) apprise you of the progress of your request, if the search or review of the records that you requested is still on-going.


Colleen Dawson
Senior Counsel

NYSERDA
17 Columbia Circle | Albany, NY 12203-6399
P: 518-862-1090 ext. 3454 | C: 518-928-7510 | Email: Colleen.Dawson@nyserda.ny.gov<mailto:Colleen.Dawson@nyserda.ny.gov>
